vectorData.altText: 7. All modalities of general sensation from the body and face relay through the _____________ ______________ nucleus of the thalamus.
That is incorrect. Click here      to learn the answer, then come back to try again.

That’s right!  All modalities of general sensation from the body and face are transmitted to third-order neurons located in the ventral posterior (VP) nucleus of the thalamus. Axons project from there to the primary somatosensory cortex.

While there are two, distinct somatosensory pathways to learn, the spinothalamic tract (STT) and the dorsal columns / medial lemniscus system (DC/ML), they share certain similarities. 
Both pathways consist of a three neuron chain, these being the first order (1°), second order (2°), and third order (3°) neuron. We’ll colour code them here:




The 1° neuron is pseudounipolar; its cell body is in a ganglion in the PNS.
For the body, its cell body is located in a dorsal root ganglion
For the face, its cell body is (usually) in the trigeminal ganglion
The 2° neuron is the one that varies between the two pathways, the STT and DC/ML.
The cell body of the 2° neuron is in the dorsal horn of the spinal cord OR a brainstem nucleus, and its axon projects to the contralateral thalamus. Therefore it’s the axon of the 2° neuron that decussates.
The cell body of the 3° neuron is located in the ventral posterior (VP) nucleus of the thalamus. Its axon projects to 1° somatosensory (SS) cortex, where the sensation is perceived.
